Long_description: Year in which the survey data collection, or most of the collection, is carried out.
The country in which the person/household has his/her usual residence, defined according to the Eurostat Standard Code list (SCL) GEO.
Unique identifier assigned to each household, used as a key variable for analysis, sampling, and tracking.
The day in which the data are collected, or the household is interviewed.
The month in which the data are collected, or the household is interviewed.
The year in which the data is collected or the household is interviewed.

Short_description: Person responding to the household questionnaire
Long_description: The household respondent is the person from whom household-level information is obtained, chosen based on specific priorities.

Short_description: Number of minutes to complete the household questionnaire
Long_description: The value of this variable refers to the count of minutes required to fill the household interview.
Household classification based on composition (e.g., single-person, couple, lone parent, multi-generational).
